intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. connatum, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves that are often hairy and lobed. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its botanical features make it identifiable and ecologically significant in its native environments.
